page.title: 13PERSONALITY IN WELWYN
page.content: LtCol Sir Martin Gilliat GCVO MBE lives at Appletrees Cottage in Welwyn. He has been Vice-Lieutenant of Herts since 1971 and since 1956 has served as Private Secretary to Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother. Born on 8.2.1913, son of the late LtCol John Babington Gilliat and Muriel Helen Lycette Gilliat, Sir Martin was educated at Eton and then at the Royal Military College Sandhurst. He joined the KRRC in 1933 and served through the 1939-45 War, being mentioned in despatches. As a prisoner of war he was an inmate of Colditz Camp. From 1947-48 he was Deputy Military Secretary to the Viceroy and Governor General of India, from 1948-51 Comptroller to the Commissioner- General for the UK in SE Asia and from 1953-55 Military Secretary to the Governor General of Australia.
